message.content:
Below is one workable “interpretation” of the tower and the small four‐block array, consistent with the no‐rotation rule and the block shapes/orientations as shown.  It uses a total of 14 pieces.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN (TOWER) STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Overall Count:
  – Tower uses 10 blocks  
  – Small side structure uses 4 blocks  
  – Total = 14 blocks  

• Tower Layers (bottom to top):
  1. Bottom Layer: one yellow rectangular bar.  
  2. Second Layer: a large red “ring” made by four red arch‐type blocks arranged in a square so that their curved cutouts form a circular opening in front.  
  3. Third Layer: another yellow rectangular bar resting atop the red ring.  
  4. Fourth Layer: two upright orange cylinders (columns) set left and right.  
  5. Fifth Layer: a third yellow rectangular bar bridging across the two columns.  
  6. Sixth/Top Layer: an orange triangular wedge placed on top as a “roof.”  

• Small Side Structure:
  – All on one layer on the ground:  
    1 green cube, 1 blue cube, and 2 yellow half‐cylinders, arranged in a 2 × 2 square so that the half‐cylinders sit in front, cubes in back.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTED BLOCKS (BY DICTIONARY INDEX)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

A)  TOWER (10 blocks):
   – (3) Yellow rectangular bars → index 7  (three copies)
   – (4) Red arch‐blocks (forming the ring) → index 1  (four copies)
   – (2) Orange cylinders (vertical) → index 9  (two copies)
   – (1) Orange triangular wedge (roof) → index 16 (one copy)

B)  SMALL SIDE STRUCTURE (4 blocks):
   – (1) Green cube → index 5  
   – (1) Blue cube → index 4  
   – (2) Yellow half‐cylinders → index 12 (two copies)

Hence the required indices (and their counts) are:  
• #1 × 4  
• #4 × 1  
• #5 × 1  
• #7 × 3  
• #9 × 2  
• #12 × 2  
• #16 × 1  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‑BY‑STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 7   (place bottom yellow bar)
  Step2:  Move block with index 1   (first red arch for ring)
  Step3:  Move block with index 1   (second red arch for ring)
  Step4:  Move block with index 1   (third red arch for ring)
  Step5:  Move block with index 1   (fourth red arch for ring)
  Step6:  Move block with index 7   (middle yellow bar on top of red ring)
  Step7:  Move block with index 9   (first orange cylinder)
  Step8:  Move block with index 9   (second orange cylinder)
  Step9:  Move block with index 7   (yellow bar bridging over the two cylinders)
  Step10: Move block with index 16  (orange triangular wedge at the top)

  -- Now place the small 2×2 grouping to the side --

  Step11: Move block with index 4   (blue cube)
  Step12: Move block with index 5   (green cube)
  Step13: Move block with index 12  (first yellow half cylinder)
  Step14: Move block with index 12  (second yellow half cylinder)
}

Following those steps (without reorienting any piece from how it appears in the dictionary) will reproduce the tower on the left and the four‐block arrangement on the right exactly as shown.
